g.title: EleanorRank5Convo6 begins.
g.text: EleanorRank5Convo6 begins.

g.title: j132037237
g.text: You might notice the Mall feeling a little different this morning.

g.title: j2855586532
g.text: Nothing big and obvious. Just a few more smiles on a few more faces. A laugh here and there. A sprinkle of happiness on the air.

g.title: j2617790819
g.text: That’s down to you, right?

g.title: j2964292978
g.text: BRB. [End.]

g.title: j211926765
g.text: Just my way of giving back. A telepath can send as well as receive, as you know. It doesn’t have to be a hosepipe jet to one person. It can be more like a fine mist sprayed over an area.

g.title: Chat ends.
g.text: Chat ends.

g.title: j4018878302
g.text: Do you have lawn sprinklers where you come from?

g.title: j1793616401
g.text: We have VERD-IE and drones like her. They looked after the plants on the Zariman. Is that the kind of thing you mean?

g.title: j1675747318
g.text: Sprink...lers?

g.title: j3770182231
g.text: It’ll do.

g.title: j2257935713
g.text: Yes, my dear, sprinklers. Water sprayers for keeping your lawn nice and damp.

g.title: j2851982116
g.text: I loved lawn sprinklers when I was a little girl. They were magical. When the sun was brightest, you could catch rainbows in them. You’d run through them and feel a delicious chill all over.

g.title: j2350620769
g.text: Also ideal for holding your brother's face up to until he screams.

g.title: j3152364103
g.text: ‘Happiness is a lawn sprinkler’. Put that on a greetings card.

g.title: j1641005240
g.text: You seem in a good mood today. I’m glad to see that.

g.title: j1423896483
g.text: I am. And I don’t see why I should keep it to myself. So I’m suffusing the whole Mall with it.

g.title: j3431684731
g.text: Isn’t that a bit like drugging people?

g.title: j2581987026
g.text: Broadcasting a positive mood? Why not. I can’t see how that’s any different to playing music.

g.title: j2536303445
g.text: So today’s the day I might see Arthur smile?

g.title: j3686155074
g.text: ... great. Here I am trying to be the secret happiness fairy sprinkling joy, and instead I get to be the evil drug goblin. My happy mood just nosedived.

g.title: j489337304
g.text: Oh! Nice analogy!

g.title: j566121909
g.text: Maybe. I hope so. He’s had to put up with so much.

g.title: j3054815946
g.text: Fine. I'll stop.

g.title: j4055624587
g.text: If Aoi can influence the mood through music, I can do it through vibes, right?

g.title: j481878153
g.text: So much has changed since you came. I don’t just mean you and me. I mean all of it. Even the Mall.

g.title: j898569882
g.text: I’m glad Aoi persuaded me to stay. Bless her.

g.title: j163240668
g.text: Wait. She did what?

g.title: j4082417468
g.text: Back up. I missed something.

g.title: j1745240783
g.text: I didn’t tell you?

g.title: j1768154389
g.text: Ah. This was not long before you arrived. We’d been out all day trying to stamp out a Techrot hive. There was a murderous tension in the air. Fighting usually burns the anger out of us and leaves us too exhausted to lash out at one another, but this day was different.

g.title: j1026878656
g.text: I remember Arthur said something like ‘we do this all again tomorrow’ and it hit us all like a sledgehammer. Nobody spoke a word on the ride back to the Mall.

g.title: j122943665
g.text: Wow. Way to boost team morale, Arthur.

g.title: j2056230311
g.text: He can be such a charmer...

g.title: j3627715680
g.text: He has a lot on his shoulders. That takes a toll.

g.title: j423944254
g.text: I think he was just trying to get us to focus on the job. But I just felt broken. Arthur and Aoi weren’t speaking, Amir was getting on Quincy’s nerves so much I was starting to fear for his life, and Lettie was side-eyeing me every chance she got.

g.title: j2843116733
g.text: Yes. Usually he manages to hide it, even when he's running on fumes. But I guess he just had nothing left.

g.title: j207112619
g.text: I spent a lot of time looking into mirrors that day. I kept imagining my reflection grabbing me by the throat and hissing ‘YOU are the problem. If it wasn’t for you, none of this would be happening.’

g.title: j216719014
g.text: He'd burned himself out trying to keep the team together.

g.title: j1839973550
g.text: Sounds like everyone else had gotten into YOUR head for a change.

g.title: j3498670321
g.text: That sounds like the kind of crap Lettie comes out with.

g.title: j1223979050
g.text: Oh, this wasn't them. This was me. Every pent-up scrap of self-doubt and self-hatred I'd been keeping down came surging up that day.

g.title: j3479942866
g.text: Thank you. I know you’ve got my back, and it means a lot to me.

g.title: j1588146867
g.text: I thought to myself: what this group needs is a scapegoat.

g.title: j50030193
g.text: I’d heard that line from Lettie so many times, I ended up thinking to myself: maybe she’s right. I’m putting everyone in danger by staying here.

g.title: j2338067156
g.text: A monster. Someone to blame.

g.title: j1817036359
g.text: I came up with a whole plan. I’d slip away in the night, hide out in the city somewhere Arthur would never find me, and - this is the part I was most proud of - carry on helping at a distance.

g.title: j2598684857
g.text: I think he’d have found you. He’s pretty determined.

g.title: j1706107728
g.text: The more likely scenario is that he would have died trying to find you.

g.title: j986813897
g.text: How? Amir can’t trace telepathy.

g.title: j1078725685
g.text: Trying to guilt me?

g.title: j396198041
g.text: I was going to be a noble exile. I’d crouch on rooftops looking all windswept and resolute. I could report on Techrot buildup, let the Hex know where the Scaldra were setting up roadblocks, even act as an emergency comms relay. Every time I saved Lettie’s arse, I’d really make her feel it. Petty? Definitely.

g.title: j3988112058
g.text: Don't bother. I feel dreadful enough already.

g.title: j652821566
g.text: I chose my moment. I waited until Amir was asleep. Then I pulled a long coat on and headed for the garage as silently as I could.

g.title: j1823869010
g.text: The security grate came down by itself. I turned around and there Aoi was.

g.title: j649908833
g.text: We talked all night and cried in each other’s arms. She was hurting, too. Deeply. By the time the sun came up, I’d decided to stay.

g.title: j1354565639
g.text: There’s still time to change your mind.

g.title: j3987320525
g.text: Aoi’s wonderful. I’m glad she was there for you.

g.title: j3071127968
g.text: That was lucky.

g.title: j303761552
g.text: Whatever grotesque impulse led you to write that, I hope you choke on it.

g.title: j2109749045
g.text: +20 Chemistry

g.title: j4015125237
g.text: Yes. All six of us needed to be here on New Year’s Eve, I think. And you, of course. The stranger at the door, bringing good luck.
